English: Grandmother, breed me hens
Pulaar: Neene baaba , ne'anee lam gerto

English: When they are many, I will exchange them for roosters
Pulaar: Si ɗen ɗuuɗii , mi waɗtita e ndonto

English: When they are many, I will exchange them for goats
Pulaar: Si ɗen ɗuuɗii , mi waɗtita e be'i

English: When they are many, I will exchange them for sheep
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii , mi waɗtita e baali

English: Sheep and goats, I will exchange them for cows
Pulaar: Dammi ɗin mi waɗtita e na'i

English: Heifers, I will exchange them for horses
Pulaar: Nyalbi ɗin , mi waɗtita e pucci

English: Mother cows, I will exchange them for dromedaries
Pulaar: Kaabi ɗin , mi waɗtita e gelooɗi

English: Milk, I will exchange it for rifles
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e pinka

English: The balls and the arrows will be used to protect the cattle
Pulaar: Kure e laanye , mi hiwira ndin jawdi

English: Milk, I will exchange it for strings
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e ɓoggi

English: With the strings I will attach the calves to the stake
Pulaar: Ɓoggi ɗin , mi saaniray nyalbi

English: Milk, I will exchange it for fonio
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e fonnye

English: Milk, I will exchange it for rice
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e maaro

English: Milk, I will exchange it for corn
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e kaaba

English: Milk, I will exchange it for millet
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e ngawri

English: Milk, I will exchange it for mafé
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen , mi waɗtita e maafe

English: And my house will live in abundance
Pulaar: Galle am heewa haarannde

English: Grandmother, breed me cows
Pulaar: Neene baaba , ne'anee lam na'i

English: When they are numerous, I will exchange them for gold
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii , mi waɗtita e kaŋŋe

English: When they are many, I will exchange them for houses
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii , mi waɗtita e cuuɗi

English: When they are many, I will exchange them for books
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii , mi waɗtita e defte

English: Marabouts with granted prayers
Pulaar: Cerno'en du'anaa-jaabii

English: Will pray that I am blessed
Pulaar: Du'oo mi wonta barkinɗo

English: They will pray for me to be loved by everyone
Pulaar: Du'oo mi wonta muybinɗo

English: For a boy
Pulaar: Gimol boobo gorko

English: I will ask for the king's daughter in marriage and I will marry her
Pulaar: Mi toroo mi jommba jiwo laamɗo

English: I will give him pure gold in a dowry
Pulaar: Mi teŋira mo kaŋŋe siiwaaɗe

English: I will add an enclosure of heifers
Pulaar: Mi waɗta ɗon dinngiraa nyalbi

English: I will add a hundred mother cows
Pulaar: Mi waɗta ɗon teemedere kaabi

English: I will add a hundred bulls
Pulaar: Mi waɗta ɗon teemedere ga'i

English: I will put it on the Bilqis horse
Pulaar: Mi waɗɗina mo puccu Bilqiisa

English: I will push him a little the sun towards the horizon
Pulaar: Mi liiƴana mo naange ngen seeɗa

English: I will give him in my hands, the moonlight of the night
Pulaar: Mi tammbina mo leelewal jemma

English: The stars, I will make him a carpet like gravel
Pulaar: Koode ɗen mi waɗtana mo koccu

English: She has the braids of the Foûta Queen
Pulaar: Himo moorii moorɗi Neene Fuuta

English: She wears the clothes of paradise
Pulaar: Himo ɓornii comci aljanna

English: She has the ornaments like Queen Bilqis
Pulaar: O cuɗorii wa Neene Bilqiisa

English: She flavored herself with the flowers of paradise
Pulaar: O urnorii piindi aljanna

English: When it comes out, the sun turns pale
Pulaar: Si o yaltitii , naange ngen sooyɗa

English: When she smiles, night gives way to day
Pulaar: Si o moosii , jemma on weeta

English: When she walks, he falls from gold in his path
Pulaar: Si o feƴƴii , kaŋŋe ɗen saama

English: Friends and enemies rush to collect it
Pulaar: Giɗo e ganyo adondira hocca

English: The soldiers' arcs protect her
Pulaar: Himo hiwiraa laanye suufaaɓe

English: Delivered swords guard it
Pulaar: Himo reeniraa kaafa saafaaɗe

English: The eye sees, the hand does not touch
Pulaar: Yiitere yi'ay , junngo meemaali

English: Wherever she goes, people are amazed
Pulaar: Ka o feƴƴi woo , yimɓe ɓen haawoo

English: They wonder: "Who is this magnificent person?"»»
Pulaar: Hiɓe lamndoo : « Ko hommbo woni oo lobbo ? »

English: An advisor to the Court replies: "It is the king's daughter"
Pulaar: Mbatula jaboo : « Oo ko jiwo laamɗo »

English: Young people wonder: "Who is the husband?"»»
Pulaar: Sagataaɓe lamndoo : « Ko hommbo woni gennda ? »

English: The Dieli and Gawlo griots answer: "Sori Son de Pennda"
Pulaar: Jeli e ngawlo no jaaboo : « Ko Sori mo Pennda »

English: Enemies have exploding belly
Pulaar: Ayɓe ɓen , deedi mum fetti

English: Young people, all, melt in tears
Pulaar: Sagataaɓe fow , gonɗi mum hibbi

English: I stand near the lucky
Pulaar: Mi daroo moggo wela-hoore

English: Young girls dance and turn, others applaud
Pulaar: Curbaaɓe ama no taaroo , ɓeya no kella

English: People ask, "What's going on at the Foûta?"»»
Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Ko waɗi Fuuta ? »

English: We answer them: "It is the marriage of Sori Son de Pennda"
Pulaar: Ɓeya no jaaboo : « Ko jommbugal Sori mo Pennda »

English: They ask, "What prevents stars from shining?"»»
Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Koode ko haɗi jalba ? »

English: And the stars answer: "It is the embarrassment in front of the looseness of the lucky"
Pulaar: Koode ɗen jaaboo : « Ko hersugol cuɗaari wela-hoore »

English: They ask, "What prevents the moon from shining?"»»
Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Leele ko haɗi jalba ? »

English: And the moon in turn replies: "It is the embarrassment in front of the beauty of the king's daughter"
Pulaar: Leele kadi jaaboo : « Ko hersugol ŋari jiwo laamɗo »

English: They go so far as to ask the sun why he doesn't shine
Pulaar: Hay naange no lamndee ko haɗi jalba

English: He replies: "It's because of the bride's smile"
Pulaar: Ngen jaaboo : « Ko moose jommbajjo »

English: Some cry
Pulaar: Ɓeya no eewnoo

English: The others whisper
Pulaar: Ɓeya no sowndoo

English: Others contemplate
Pulaar: Ɓeya no sooynoo

English: The others marvel at
Pulaar: Ɓeya no haawoo

English: All shout, all whisper:
Pulaar: Fow no eewnoo , fow no sowndoo :

English: "It's her, the twin of this sun!"»»
Pulaar: « Ko oo tigi woni ciwto ngeya naange !

English: "She is her, the sister of this moon!"»»
Pulaar: « Ko oo tigi woni jaaja nduya lewru ! »

English: Grandmother, breed me sheep and goats
Pulaar: Neene baaba , ne'anee lam dammi

English: Grandmother, breed me cows
Pulaar: Neene baaba , ne'anee lam na'i

English: I exchange them for pure gold
Pulaar: Mi waɗtita e kaŋŋe siiwaaɗe

English: I became the husband of the king's daughter
Pulaar: Mi wonii gennda jiwo laamɗo

English: For a girl
Pulaar: Gimol boobo debbo

English: The King's son will ask me for marriage and he will marry me
Pulaar: Toroo lam jommba ɓii laamɗo

Pulaar: O liiƴana lam naange ngen seeɗa

Pulaar: O tammbina lam leelewal jemma

Pulaar: Koode ɗen o waɗtana lam koccu

Pulaar: Mi mooroo morɗi Neene Fuuta

English: I wear pardi clothes
Pulaar: Mi ɓornoo comci aljanna

English: I wear the adornments of Queen Bilqis
Pulaar: Mi cuɗoroo wa Neene Bilgisa

English: I perfume myself with the flowers of paradise
Pulaar: Mi urnoroo piindi aljanna

Pulaar: Si mi yaltitii , naange ngen soyɗa

English: When I smile, the night gives way to day
Pulaar: Si mi moosii , jemma on weeta

Pulaar: Si mi feƴƴii , kaŋŋe ɗen saama
